should be higher than 0","params":{"_amount":"of tokens to burn"}},"createVault()":{"details":"Only one vault per address can be created"},"getFee(uint256)":{"details":"The returned value is returned on ETHf = ((P * A * b)/ 100) f = Burn Fee Value P = TCAP Token Price A = Amount to Burn b = Burn Fee %","params":{"_amount":"to burn"},"returns":{"fee":"fee"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive.     * Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point.     * WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account.     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).     * If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must be `account`."},"requiredCollateral(uint256)":{"details":"TCAP token is 18 decimalsC = ((P * A * r) / 100) / cp C = Required Collateral P = TCAP Token Price A = Amount to Mint cp = Collateral Price Is only divided by 100 as eth price comes in wei to cancel the additional 0s","params":{"_amount":"uint amount to mint"},"returns":{"collateral":"of the TCAP Token"}},"requiredLiquidationCollateral(uint256)":{"details":"LC = ((((D * r) / 100) - cTcap) * 100) / (r - (p + 100)) cTcap = ((C * cp) / P) LC = Required Liquidation Collateral D = Vault Debt C = Required Collateral P = TCAP Token Price cp = Collateral Price r = Min Vault Ratio p = Liquidation Penalty","params":{"_vaultId":"of the vault to liquidate"},"returns":{"collateral":"required of the TCAP Token"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`.     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - /QmTAXUNCbihqbReG71QG5M5HdnfZFvhuaoFKRzuAghF3Gw"]}},"version":1}

TCAPPrice().details: TCAP token is 18 decimalsoracle totalMarketPrice must be in wei formatP = M / d P = TCAP Token Price M = Total Crypto Market Cap d = Divisor

createVault().details: Only one vault per address can be created

getFee(uint256).details: The returned value is returned on ETHf = ((P * A * b)/ 100) f = Burn Fee Value P = TCAP Token Price A = Amount to Burn b = Burn Fee %

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive.     * Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point.     * WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getVaultRatio(uint256).details: vr = (cp * (C * 100)) / D - P vr = Vault Ratio C = Vault Collateral cp = Collateral Price D = Vault Debt P = TCAP Token Price

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`.     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

initialize(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint2.details: Only owner can call itCan only be called once

liquidationReward(uint256).details: the returned value is returned on the vault collateralR = (LC * (p  + 100)) / 100 R = Liquidation Reward LC = Required Liquidation Collateral p = liquidation penalty

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account.     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).     * If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must be `account`.

requiredCollateral(uint256).details: TCAP token is 18 decimalsC = ((P * A * r) / 100) / cp C = Required Collateral P = TCAP Token Price A = Amount to Mint cp = Collateral Price Is only divided by 100 as eth price comes in wei to cancel the additional 0s

requiredLiquidationCollateral(uint256).details: LC = ((((D * r) / 100) - cTcap) * 100) / (r - (p + 100)) cTcap = ((C * cp) / P) LC = Required Liquidation Collateral D = Vault Debt C = Required Collateral P = TCAP Token Price cp = Collateral Price r = Min Vault Ratio p = Liquidation Penalty

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`.     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

TCAPPrice().notice: Returns the price of the TCAP token

burn(uint256).notice: Burns TCAP Tokens releasing the staked collateral

getFee(uint256).notice: Returns the required fee to burn the TCAP tokens

getVaultRatio(uint256).notice: Returns the Collateral Ratio fo the Vault

initialize(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint2.notice: Allows the orchestrator to initialize the contract

liquidateVault(uint256,uint256).notice: Allow users to liquidate vaults with low collateral ratio

liquidationReward(uint256).notice: Returns Reward for liquidating a vault

mint(uint256).notice: Mints TCAP Tokens staking the collateral

pause().notice: Allows owner to Pause the Contract

removeCollateral(uint256).notice: Removes not used collateral from collateral

requiredCollateral(uint256).notice: Returns the minimal required collateral to mint TCAP token

requiredLiquidationCollateral(uint256).notice: Returns the minimal required TCAP to liquidate a Vault

retrieveFees().notice: Sends the owner of the contract the Fees saved on ETH

setBurnFee(uint256).notice: Sets the collateral ratio needed to mint tokens

setCollateralContract(address).notice: Sets the address of the collateral contract

setCollateralPriceOracle(address).notice: Sets the address of the oracle contract for the price feed

setDivisor(uint256).notice: Sets the divisor amount for token price calculation

setETHPriceOracle(address).notice: Sets the address of the oracle contract for the ETH price feed

setLiquidationPenalty(uint256).notice: Sets the liquidation penalty % charged on liquidation

setRatio(uint256).notice: Sets the collateral ratio needed to mint tokens

setTCAPContract(address).notice: Sets the address of the TCAP ERC20 contract

setTCAPOracle(address).notice: Sets the address of the oracle contract for the price feed

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: ERC165 Standard for support of interfaces

unpause().notice: Allows owner to Unpause the Contract

userdoc.notice: Contract in charge of handling the TCAP Vault and stake using a Collateral ERC20
